html.p: What: Returns the *most common value* of the field specified along with some statistics about that field
Why: Occasionally useful for reporting things, but often useful when you are exploring the data.
So What: Quicker than doing your own stats to get these same statistics on a single field and how common it is.
See also rare which is the "reverse" of this command.

panel.html: We're using data we built earlier by using outputlookup. To build this see outputlookup | inputlookup mydata.csv While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is: "_time",salesperson,"Cars Sold This Hour" 1711665905,Rich,1 1711665905,David,1 1711662305,Rich,0 1711662305,David,0 1711658705,Rich,1 1711658705,David,2 1711655105,Rich,2 1711655105,David,3
And here's the data with top "Cars Sold This Hour" applied. "1" is the most common, so it's at the top. Pun intended, lol.
panel.title: Using top

search.query: | inputlookup mydata.csv | top "Cars Sold This Hour"
